comments:
When launching an RCP application on AIX 5.3, I get a message:

An error has occurred. See the log file ...workspace/.metadata/.log. The contents of the log file are shown below. Basically, it seems it is using the MToolkit, even though I have AWT_TOOLKIT set to XToolkit on the console before starting up. We use Eclipse 3.2RC3 currently.

After doing a quick check, I found on the IBM website that the Java SDK for AIX does not support the XToolkit, but would use the Motif Toolkit. Here is the link to that information:

http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/java/jdk/aix/j532/sdkguide.aix32.html#wq103

I think the SWT_AWT bridge requires XToolkit to be used. Does this mean that apps that use SWT_AWT would not be supported on AIX?

SSQ is it believed that swt_awt works on aix?  I tried snippet135 on jimi and it segfaults.
The bridge will not work with MToolkit. It requires XToolkit.
As the notes for the Java SDK on AIX say, it does not support the XToolkit. I guess this means that SWT_AWT is not supported on AIX...?

(In reply to comment #2)
> The bridge will not work with MToolkit. It requires XToolkit.

So this means that the AWT_SWT toolkit is not supported on AIX?  Because the Java VM on AIX does not support XToolkit only MToolkit it can only be deduced that AWT_SWT bridge will not work on AIX.  

So the only two options that I know of.  Is there anyway the Bridge cand work with MToolkit too.  Is there anyway we can get IBM to support XToolkit?

MToolkit could not be made to work on Linux because AWT and SWT linked to two different motif libraries. I believe that on AIX there is only one Motif library, so MToolkit might work. On the other hand, apps are ususally staticaly linked to Motif on AIX, so there could be two copies of the library. Anyway, we need to investigate more.

MToolkit does not have the XEmbed protocol that Sun implemented as part of the interop story.  This means it will never work with any other X application (including SWT).  A better solution would be to get IBM to support XToolkit.  We can't/won't invest any time to get MToolkit to work.

(In reply to comment #6)
> MToolkit does not have the XEmbed protocol that Sun implemented as part of the
> interop story.  This means it will never work with any other X application
> (including SWT).  A better solution would be to get IBM to support XToolkit. 
> We can't/won't invest any time to get MToolkit to work.

Just a quick update with IBM's inititial position towards supporting XToolkit feature that the AWT_SWT bridge requires on Posix based systems.

IBM has decided to defer implementation of the XToolkit on AIX and z/OS until Java 6 and IBM can't yet offer a release date for Java 6 on AIX.
Wow.  Let's try and get this changed.
